poem:
Title: "Fragments of War"

In the whispers of dawn, a tank rolls over a sign,
Triumphantly an Israeli flag ascends the Palestinian sky.
Its shadow blankets Rahaf, a border scarred by lines,
Where whispers of ceasefire burgeon, fleetingly shy.

In the wider region, Iran exhales beneath the sun,
Unmentioned in this snippet, yet woven in this tale.
Indeed, a day's beginning is another day's done—
Echoes of conflict, in newsprint stale.
